info.name: MimePost
info.description:
# üìß MimePost API

**MimePost** is a secure, high-performance **transactional email delivery platform** designed for developers, startups, and businesses that need to send **business-critical emails** with maximum deliverability and privacy.

This Postman collection provides **ready-to-use API requests** for sending, managing, and tracking emails using the MimePost HTTP API.

---

## üöÄ Key Features

- **Transactional Email Only** ‚Äî Send critical messages like receipts, OTPs, password resets, and notifications.
    
- **Template-Based Sending** ‚Äî All emails use approved templates (raw HTML sending is not allowed).
    
- **Domain & DKIM Verification** ‚Äî Secure your sending domain for maximum deliverability.
    
- **Webhooks** ‚Äî Get real-time updates for delivered, opened, bounced, or failed messages.
    
- **Email Logs** ‚Äî Track every message and event with detailed logs.
    

---

## üîê Authentication

All requests require an **API Token**.

1. Log in to your [MimePost Dashboard](https://mimepost.com/app/integration/api_tokens?utm_source=postman.com).
    
2. Go to **Integration ‚Üí API Tokens**.
    
3. Create or copy your token.
    
4. In Postman, set it as an environment variable: api_token =
    
5. Every request must include this header: X-Auth-Token: {{api_token}}
    

---

## üìÇ What‚Äôs Included

- **Email** ‚Üí Send transactional emails using templates.
    
- **Template** ‚Üí Create, copy, and manage templates.
    
- **Domains** ‚Üí Add, verify, and configure sending domains.
    
- **Webhooks** ‚Üí Set up event webhooks for tracking.
    
- **Billing** ‚Üí View account billing information.
    
- **Stats & Logs** ‚Üí Access email logs, statistics, and delivery insights.
    
- **Sandbox** ‚Üí Safely test email sending without impacting deliverability.
    

---

## üìù Usage Notes

- ‚ùå **No marketing or promotional emails** ‚Äî MimePost is built for **transactional and business-critical communication only**.
    
- ‚úÖ Always test new templates in the **Sandbox** before using them in production.
    
- üîí Keep your **API Tokens secure** ‚Äî never expose them publicly.
    

---

## ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Quick Start

1. Verify your sending domain in **Domains**.
    
2. Create an approved template in **Templates**.
    
3. Generate an API Token in **Integration ‚Üí API Tokens**.
    
4. Use the **Email ‚Üí Send Transactional Email** request in this collection.

item.name: Email

request.description:
### Body parameters

| Field | Type | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `template_uid` | string | yes | Approved template identifier in MimePost. |
| `subject` | string | yes | Email subject line (‚â§ 255 chars). |
| `from_email` | string (email) | yes | Sender address from a verified domain. |
| `from_name` | string | no | Friendly sender name. |
| `global_merge_vars` | array | no | Variables applied to all recipients unless overridden. |
| `to` | array | yes | Primary recipients. |
| `cc` | array | no | CC recipients. |
| `bcc` | array | no | BCC recipients. |
| `attachments` | array | no | Attachment refs (IDs/URLs if supported). |
| `vars` | object | no | Custom metadata (key‚Äìvalue pairs). |

**Recipient**  
`{ "email": string, "merge_vars": array }`

**MergeVar**  
`{ "name": string, "value": string }`

response.name: 400 Bad Request
response.body: {"success":0,"error_code":400,"message":"Sender Domain Not Approved. To fix this, either get Your Domain approved OR use a Sandbox Email"}

response.name: 404 Not Found
response.body: {"success":0,"error_code":106,"message":"Invalid template_uid provided or template not approved"}
